name: IEEE float precision: x/x != 1
author: FabriceNeyret2
description:
a  reminder that x/x is not always exactly 1 on computer (ex: 33/33), especially with IEEE float, especially on GPU.
( because is 33*(1/33), and 1/33 cannot be represented exactly in IEEE floats. )
ticks every 0%10.

name: pseudo-Tron screensaver 3
author: FabriceNeyret2
description:
variant of [url]https://shadertoy.com/view/WlyGz3[/url]
variant of [url]https://shadertoy.com/view/ttyGWD[/url]
buffer_a_code:
// variant of https://shadertoy.com/view/ttyGWD
void mainImage(out vec4 O, vec2 U) { mi }
common_code:
// +6: wow: a windows Angle compatibility bug forbids using (cond)?: for iFrame==0 || O.w < 0.
//                                            cf: https://www.shadertoy.com/view/wtV3DW

#define T(U) texture( iChannel0, U / H.xy )                    //
#define mi                                                      \
    vec4 H = iResolution.xyzz;   int t = iFrame;                \
    O = T(U);                                                   \
    if (U.y < 1.)  /* move particles */                         \
        if ( t < 1 || O.w < 1. )                                \
            H = fract( sin( (iTime+U.x) * H ) *4e4 ),           \
            O = H, O.z*=6.3, O.w = exp(fract(H.z*4.)*5.)-1. ;   \
        else O.xy = fract( O.xy + (U.x==.5 ? cos(O.z+vec2(11,0))\
                                           : (T(vec2(0))-O).xy )\
                                 *H.y/1e2/H.xy ),               \
             O.z +=.1, O.w-- ;                                  \
    else           /* draw trajectories */                      \
        for( H--, O *= .97; H.z++ < 4e2; )                      \
            O = mix( O, .6 + .6 * cos( H.z + vec4(0,23,21,0) ), \
                     clamp( H.y/2e2 - length( U - (H*T(H.zw)).xy )*20./T(H.zw).w, 0.,1. ) );

name: pseudo-Tron screensaver 2
author: FabriceNeyret2
description: variant of [url]https://shadertoy.com/view/ttyGWD[/url]
buffer_a_code:
// variant of https://shadertoy.com/view/ttyGWD
void mainImage(out vec4 O, vec2 U) { mi }
common_code:
// +6: wow: a windows Angle compatibility bug forbids using (cond)?: for iFrame==0 || O.w < 0.
//                                            cf: https://www.shadertoy.com/view/wtV3DW

#define T(U) texture( iChannel0, U / H.xy )                    //
#define mi                                                      \
    vec4 H = iResolution.xyzz;   int t = iFrame;                \
    O = T(U);                                                   \
    if (U.y < 1.)  /* move particles */                         \
        if ( t < 1 || O.w < 1. )                                \
            H = fract( sin( (iTime+U.x) * H ) *4e4 ),           \
            O = H, O.z*=6.3, O.w = exp(fract(H.z*4.)*5.)-1. ;   \
        else O.xy = fract( O.xy + cos(O.z+vec2(11,0)) * O.w*H.y/4e3/H.xy ),\
             O.z +=.1, O.w-- ;                                  \
    else           /* draw trajectories */                      \
        for( H--, O *= .97; H.z++ < 2e2; )                      \
            O = mix( O, .6 + .6 * cos( H.z + vec4(0,23,21,0) ), \
                     clamp( H.y/2e2 - length( U - (H*T(H.zw)).xy )*9./T(H.zw).w, 0.,1. ) );

name: Continuum Mechanics
author: wyatt
description: divergence and curl is just about all you can say about a vector field - ignore torsion (ie delete w channel) - and this becomes a fluid simulation. This simulates a solid because it stores torsional energy.

#define R iResolution.xy
#define A(U) texture(iChannel0,(U)/R)
#define B(U) texture(iChannel1,(U)/R)
#define C(U) texture(iChannel2,(U)/R)

#define Main void mainImage( out vec4 Q, in vec2 U )
#define Neighborhood vec4 n = A(U+vec2(0,1)), e = A(U+vec2(1,0)), s = A(U-vec2(0,1)), w = A(U-vec2(1,0)), m = 0.25*(n+e+s+w);

common_code:
#define iTime (iTime + 54.1)

#define pi acos(-1.)
#define tau (2.*pi)

#define tempo 174.
#define hbeat ((60./tempo)/1.)
#define qnote (hbeat/2.)
#define beat  (hbeat*2.)
#define qbeat  (beat/4.)
#define measure  (hbeat*2.)

#define grad 0.25*vec2(e.z-w.z,n.z-s.z)
#define div 0.25*(n.y-s.y+e.x-w.x)

#define kick exp(-mod(iTime, beat)*20.)
#define halfkick exp(-mod(iTime, hbeat)*20.)

#define T(uv) texture(iChannel0, uv)
#define R iResolution.xy
#define A(U) texture(iChannel0,(U)/R)
#define B(U) texture(iChannel1,(U)/R)
#define C(U) texture(iChannel2,(U)/R)

#define Main void mainImage( out vec4 Q, in vec2 U )
#define Neighborhood vec4 n = A(U+vec2(0,1)), e = A(U+vec2(1,0)), s = A(U-vec2(0,1)), w = A(U-vec2(1,0)), m = 0.25*(n+e+s+w); 
#define rot(a) mat2(cos(a),-sin(a),sin(a),cos(a))

#define N 20.
#define For for (float i = -(N); i<=(N); i++)
#define S 3.
#define Gaussian(i) 0.3989422804/S*exp(-.5*(i)*(i)/S/S)
#define Init if (iFrame < 1) 
#define Border if (U.x<1.||U.y<1.||R.x-U.x<1.||R.y-U.y<1.)
#define Mouse if (iMouse.z>0.&&length(U-iMouse.xy)<30.) 


#define s_n  vec2(0.0, st.y)
#define s_ne  vec2(st.x, st.y)
#define s_e   vec2(st.x, 0.0)
#define s_se  vec2(st.x, -st.y)
#define s_s   vec2(0.0, -st.y)
#define s_sw  vec2(-st.x, -st.y)
#define s_w   vec2(-st.x, 0.0)
#define s_nw  vec2(-st.x, st.y)

#define uv_ne  T( U + s_ne).xyz
#define uv_nw  T( U + s_nw).xyz
#define uv_sw  T( U - s_sw).xyz
#define uv_se  T( U - s_se).xyz
#define uv_e  T( U + s_e).xyz
#define uv_n  T( U + s_n).xyz
#define uv_s  T( U + s_s).xyz
#define uv_w  T( U + s_w).xyz
#define uv_c  T( U ).xyz

const float _K0 = -20.0/6.0; // center weight
const float _K1 = 4.0/6.0; // edge-neighbors
const float _K2 = 1.0/6.0; // vertex-neighbors
const float cs = 4.95; // curl scale
const float ls = 0.24; // laplacian scale
const float ps = -0.06; // laplacian of divergence scale
const float ds = -0.08; // divergence scale
const float pwr = 0.2; // power when deriving rotation angle from curl
const float amp = 1.0; // self-amplification
const float sq2 = 0.3; // diagonal weight
float noise( vec2 st) {
    return fract(sin(dot(st.xy, vec2(12.9898, 78.233))) * 43758.1);
}

common_code:
#define R iResolution.xy
#define A(U) texture(iChannel0,(U)/R)
#define B(U) texture(iChannel1,(U)/R)
#define C(U) texture(iChannel2,(U)/R)
#define D(U) texture(iChannel3,(U)/R)

#define Main void mainImage( out vec4 Q, in vec2 U )

#define F(x) (sqrt(x)+exp(-40.*(x))+U.y*0e-4)

#define dt 1.
#define K .25
#define Loss .01

#define Border if (U.x<1.||U.y<1.||R.x-U.x<1.||R.y-U.y<1.) Q *= 0.;
#define Init if (iFrame < 1) Q = exp(-.01*length(U-0.5*R))*vec4(1,0,0,.5);
#define Mouse if (iMouse.z>0.) Q.xyzw += .5*exp(-.001*dot(U-iMouse.xy,U-iMouse.xy))

common_code:
#define R iResolution.xy
#define A(U) texture(iChannel0,(U)/R)
#define B(U) texture(iChannel1,(U)/R)
#define C(U) texture(iChannel2,(U)/R)
#define D(U) texture(iChannel3,(U)/R)

#define Main void mainImage( out vec4 Q, in vec2 U )

#define F(x) 1./(1.+(x))

#define dt 1.
#define K .5

#define Border if (U.x<1.||U.y<1.||R.x-U.x<1.||R.y-U.y<1.) Q *= 0.;
#define Init if (iFrame < 1) Q = length(U-0.5*R)<30.?vec4(sin(U.x)+sin(.5*U.y),cos(.1*U.y)+cos(.5*U.x),1,0):vec4(0);
#define Mouse if (iMouse.z>0.) Q.xyzw += exp(-.01*dot(U-iMouse.xy,U-iMouse.xy))*vec4(sin(.5*U.x),cos(.25*U.x),sin(iTime),0);
